Commentary.ab: Y10.11a aϑra] Geldner, Kellens; Pirart haϑra.
Y10.11a spəṇta.fradaxšta] Geldner, Kellens; Pirart spəṇta.fradixšta,
Y10.11b vī.barən] cod., Pirart; Geldner, Kellens vībarən.

Y10.11b iš́ata] Ir. cod. clearly iš́ata (also išata and iš́iiata) as lectio difficilior, Geldner; Kellens, Pirart iškata (Ind. liturgical cod.). Cf. Pahl. škuft (Humbach and Ichaporia, 1998 pp. 70-71) speaks for iškata “house/home of refreshments” (etim. by Hoffmann). Hintze, 1994 p. 77 iš́iiata (IIr. *īč-ḭa-ta- “[widely] visible”) seems secondary.

Y10.11b upāiri.saēna] Geldner, Bartholomae, Pirart; Kellens (sec. De Vaan, 2003 p. 74) upairi.saēna-. Cod. divided and VIr. upaēri°. Humbach and Ichaporia, 1998 p. 71 *upārisaina- “covered with juniper”. Cf. Pahl. abārsēn.
Y10.11b-c iš́ata. upāiri saēna ... staēra. starō.sāra ... kusrāδa. kusrō.patāδa ... paβrāna. višpaϑa] Pirart iškata.upāiri saēna ... staēra.starō.sāra ... kusrāδa.kusrō.patāδa ... paβrāna.višpaϑa.
Y10.11c viš.paϑa] sec. cod.; Geldner, Kellens, Pirart višpaϑa. Vid. com. Y10.4 višpaϑa, adverb.
Y10.11c spita.gaōna] Geldner, Kellens; Pirart spiti.gaona.
